intro: Buchtienia boliviensis var. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian buchtienia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Ecuador and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at elevations ranging from 2,000 to 4,000 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a velvety texture, while its flowers range in color from pink to purple. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments.
